intro: Psychotria phytolaccea, commonly known as the red-eyed beauty, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with white petals and prominent yellow stamens. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Psychotria phytolaccea is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in indigenous medicine.
